text:
He climbed the dark staircase, heart racing. 

“What if I really do it?” he thought. 

He reached the fourth floor. Porters moved furniture nearby. 

“Just the old woman left,” he whispered. 

He rang the bell. 

It tinkled softly, like a warning. 

The door creaked open a crack. 

A pair of glittering eyes stared back at him.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man nervously approaches the old woman's flat, feeling increasingly anxious about his intentions.
